legacyCollection.name: Europe
legacyCollection.longDescription: The latest news, analysis and investigations from Europe.

headline.default: The War in Ukraine Has Unleashed a New Word

node.summary: In a creative play on three different languages, Ukrainians identify an enemy: ‘ruscism.’

headline.default: Russians Seize 42 Towns in Eastern Ukraine as Fighting Intensifies

bylines.renderedRepresentation: By Anton Troianovski, Ivan Nechepurenko and Michael Levenson

node.summary: Ukrainian military officials vowed to reverse Russia’s territorial gains in what was turning into a grinding back-and-forth struggle along a front stretching more than 300 miles.

headline.default: Dug in on the front lines, Ukrainian soldiers fight to repel the Russian onslaught.

node.summary: After near-annihilation, and a marriage proposal, a Ukrainian unit has become a group of hardened veterans, dug in and determined.

headline.default: Hackers Claim to Target Russian Institutions in Barrage of Cyberattacks and Leaks

bylines.renderedRepresentation: By Kate Conger and David E. Sanger

node.summary: While the authenticity of leaked data could not be verified, the effort appears to be part of a campaign by hackers opposed to the Kremlin.

headline.default: For France’s Muslims, a Choice Between Lesser Evils in Presidential Vote

bylines.renderedRepresentation: By Norimitsu Onishi and Aida Alami

node.summary: In Sunday’s decisive runoff election, they have a distasteful choice between Macron and Le Pen. They won’t necessarily back Macron.
